page.title: 04 Glasgow Abbatoir.
page.content: Built by Glasgow District Council in 1972 on the site of an old cattle market.It provides the services of animal slaughter for traders and ritual slaughter for religious sects. One of three council-owned abbatoirs in Scotland,it is the largest in Europe. When threatened with closure it was taken over by a consortium of 22 people who rent premises from the District Council.Animals handled in l984 were:Cattle 54,272 Sheep 154,791, Pigs 26,453 and a few goats for ritual slaughter.Animals from all over Britain are rested for a minimum of l2 hours before being humanely slaughtered by captive bolt stunning pen as stress affects the meat.This process takes 45 minutes for cattle and 20 minutes for sheep and pigs.
